lines.content: * Represents a task with a deadline.
* A Deadline object corresponds to a task with a specific due date/time.
/** The date/time by which the task should be completed. */
* Constructs a new Deadline object with the specified description and due date/time.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The due date/time of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline object, including its status and due date/time.
* @return A string representing the Deadline object.
* Returns a string in the file format used to save the Deadline object to disk.
* @return A string representing the Deadline object in the file format.
* Represents a task that occurs within a specific time frame.
* An Event object corresponds to a task with a start and end time.
/** The start date/time of the event. */
/** The end date/time of the event. */
* Constructs a new Event object with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start date/time of the event.
* @param to The end date/time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event object, including its status, start, and end times.
* @return A string representing the Event object.
* Returns a string in the file format used to save the Event object to disk.
* @return A string representing the Event object in the file format.
* Parses user inputs and executes corresponding commands.
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting user input, managing tasks,
* and interacting with the user interface and storage.
* Parses the user's input and executes the corresponding command.
* @param userInput The input string entered by the user.
* @param tasks     The list of tasks to be managed.
* @param ui        The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage   The storage handler for saving and loading tasks.
public void parse(String userInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Handles the "list" command, displaying all tasks.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to display.
* @param ui    The user interface to interact with the user.
private void handleListCommand(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
ui.showMessage("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Handles the "mark" command, marking a task as done.
* @param splitInput The user's input split into command and arguments.
* @param tasks      The list of tasks to be managed.
* @param ui         The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage    The storage handler for saving the updated tasks.
private void handleMarkCommand(String[] splitInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + tasks.get(markIndex));
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The task number is out of range.");
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The task number must be an integer.");
* Handles the "unmark" command, marking a task as not done.
* @param splitInput The user's input split into command and arguments.
* @param tasks      The list of tasks to be managed.
* @param ui         The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage    The storage handler for saving the updated tasks.
private void handleUnmarkCommand(String[] splitInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + tasks.get(unmarkIndex));
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The task number is out of range.");
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The task number must be an integer.");
* Handles the "todo" command, adding a new ToDo task.
* @param splitInput The user's input split into command and arguments.
* @param tasks      The list of tasks to be managed.
* @param ui         The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage    The storage handler for saving the updated tasks.
private void handleTodoCommand(String[] splitInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + tasks.get(tasks.size() - 1));
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Handles the "deadline" command, adding a new Deadline task.
* @param splitInput The user's input split into command and arguments.
* @param tasks      The list of tasks to be managed.
* @param ui         The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage    The storage handler for saving the updated tasks.
private void handleDeadlineCommand(String[] splitInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + tasks.get(tasks.size() - 1));
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The deadline command must include '/by <date/time>'.");
* Handles the "event" command, adding a new Event task.
* @param splitInput The user's input split into command and arguments.
* @param tasks      The list of tasks to be managed.
* @param ui         The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage    The storage handler for saving the updated tasks.
private void handleEventCommand(String[] splitInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + tasks.get(tasks.size() - 1));
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The event command must include '/from <start date/time>' and '/to <end date/time>'.");
* Handles the "delete" command, removing a task from the list.
* @param splitInput The user's input split into command and arguments.
* @param tasks      The list of tasks to be managed.
* @param ui         The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage    The storage handler for saving the updated tasks.
private void handleDeleteCommand(String[] splitInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + tasks.remove(deleteIndex));
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The task number is out of range.");
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The task number must be an integer.");
* Handles the "bye" command, saving the current tasks and exiting the program.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to be saved.
* @param ui      The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage handler for saving the tasks.
private void handleByeCommand(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Handles the "find" command, searching for tasks with the given keyword.
* @param splitInput The user's input split into command and arguments.
* @param tasks      The list of tasks to be searched.
* @param ui         The user interface to interact with the user.
private void handleFindCommand(String[] splitInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
ui.showError("OOPS!!! The find command must include a keyword.");
* The main class of the Repsmax application.
* This class initializes the necessary components and manages the flow of the program.
* @param filePath The file path where task data is stored.
* This method continuously reads user input, parses commands, and manages tasks until the user exits.
* The main entry point of the Repsmax application.
* Represents a custom exception for the Repsmax application.
* This class extends the standard {@link Exception} class to provide
* Constructs a new RepsmaxException with the specified detail message.
* The detail message is a string that describes the error or exception
* @param message the detail message, which is saved for later retrieval
* Manages the saving and loading of tasks to and from a file.
* The {@code Storage} class provides methods to save tasks to a file and
* load tasks from a file. The file path is specified during the creation
* Constructs a {@code Storage} object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath the path to the file where tasks will be saved or loaded.
* Saves the tasks to the file specified by the file path.
* Each task is written to the file in a format defined by the {@code Task}
* @param tasks the {@code TaskList} containing the tasks to be saved.
System.out.println("An error occurred while saving tasks.");
* Loads tasks from the file specified by the file path.
* If the file does not exist, a message is printed indicating that
* a new list will be started. Each line in the file is parsed using
* the {@code Task} class's {@code fromFileFormat()} method to create
* tasks that are added to the provided {@code TaskList}.
* @param tasks the {@code TaskList} to which loaded tasks will be added.
System.out.println("No task found. Starting a new List");
System.out.println("An error occurred while loading tasks.");
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* The {@code Task} class stores information about a task, including its
* description and whether it is marked as done. It provides methods to
* manipulate and retrieve the status of the task, as well as to convert
* the task to and from a file format.
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the specified description. The task
* is initially marked as not done.
* @param description the description of the task.
* Returns the status icon representing the completion status of the task.
* If the task is done, returns "X". Otherwise, returns a blank space.
* @return a string representing the task's completion status.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns whether the task is marked as done.
* @return {@code true} if the task is done, {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task in a user-friendly format.
* The format is "[X] description" if the task is done, or "[ ] description"
* if the task is not done.
* @return a string representation of the task.
* Converts the task to a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The format is "T | doneStatus | description", where "doneStatus" is
* "1" if the task is done and "0" if it is not.
* @return a string representation of the task in file format.
* Creates a {@code Task} object from a string in file format.
* The expected format is "T | doneStatus | description". The method
* splits the input string and creates a task based on the parsed data.
* @param fileFormat the string representation of the task in file format.
* @return a {@code Task} object created from the file format string.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the file format string is invalid.
* The {@code TaskList} class provides methods to manage a collection of
* {@code Task} objects. It supports adding, retrieving, removing tasks,
* and querying the size of the task list.
* Initializes the list to be empty.
* Adds a task to the list.
* @param task the {@code Task} to be added to the list.
* Retrieves a task from the list at the specified index.
* @param index the index of the task to retrieve.
* @return the {@code Task} at the specified index.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range.
* Removes a task from the list at the specified index.
* @param index the index of the task to remove.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return the number of tasks in the list.
* This method returns the underlying list of tasks. Modifications to the
* returned list will affect the {@code TaskList}.
* Searches for tasks containing the specified keyword in their description.
* This method filters the tasks and returns a list of tasks where the
* @param keyword the keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* @return a list of tasks that contain the keyword in their description.
* Represents a task without a specific date or time.
* The {@code Todo} class is a subclass of {@code Task} that denotes a task
* without any associated date or time. It provides a specific string format
* Constructs a {@code Todo} with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description the description of the todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the todo task.
* The format is "[T][statusIcon] description", where "[T]" indicates
* that the task is a todo, and the status icon is either "X" (for done)
* @return a string representation of the todo task.
* Handles all user interactions in the application.
* The {@code Ui} class is responsible for managing user input and output.
* It provides methods for reading user commands, displaying messages,
* Constructs a {@code Ui} object and initializes the scanner for reading
* Reads the next line of input from the user.
* @return the input line entered by the user.
* Displays a welcome message to the user.
* The message includes a greeting and a prompt asking what the user
System.out.println("   What can I do for you?");
* Displays a goodbye message to the user.
* The message bids farewell and expresses hope to see the user again
System.out.println("   Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays an error message when loading tasks fails.
* The message indicates that an error occurred while loading tasks
System.out.println("An error occurred while loading tasks.");
* @param message the error message to be displayed.
* Displays a horizontal line for visual separation.
* The line is used to enhance readability in the user interface output.
* Displays a custom message to the user.
* @param message the message to be displayed.
* Prompts the user for a search keyword and displays the results.
showMessage("No tasks found with the given keyword.");
showMessage("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
What can I do for you?
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
here are the task in your list:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
here are the task in your list:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
What can I do for you?
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
javac Repsmax.java Task.java Todo.java Deadline.java Event.java
